title: if in the assassin rework you're gonna make assassins kill you in substantially more time.
body: what are you gonna do about mid-late game ad carries and mages killing you under a second? are you gonna nerf damage across the board or what? if non-assassins kill you faster than assassins in general then we have a big design flaw.

"Big design flaw" is existence of class who's whole gameplay is about killing their enemy as fast as possible with lowest possible amount of counterplay. Except for few edge cases like Annie, mages and marksman have incomparably more counterplay than assassins. 

Those few low-counterplay oddballs still exist mostly _because_ of assassins existence (as Rito said about her rework, they _needed_ to keep one insta-stun burst mage({{champion:1}}) in the game where there are so many high-mobility high-damage champions), and their damage is hit hard because of counterplay lacks(i.e. Annie vs Fizz easily yields >1000 damage difference in sheer upfront burst, not including Fizz's enhanced LB procs and vastly superior DPS). It only seems high because most players don't bother to build any defenses. Assassins damage is usually high enough to ignore quite big amounts of defensive stats, as killing enemies fast is the only way they benefit their team.

There is a good reason why Rito releases _no_ assassins champions for almost _4 years_ now . Extending their burst window might seem odd, but is certainly a good thing for overall game health.

there's a design flaw because there's very little risk involved for those that play said class. As rito's philosophy for assassins is: they should be able to kill you and they should be nimble, going in and out of fights with ease.

So, lets say Zed goes in and kills your ADC. That sucks, but if you can kill Zed in the next 2 second as he went out of position to go and kill your ADC, then you can still win that fight easy. The issue there was addressed by Riot actually a while back.

They basically said: *If an assassin kills their target in a split second and instantly dies the second after, then nobody is happy. The AD Carry isn't happy because he died obviously, but that's unavoidable. The assassin isn't happy because he just instantly exploded and there was nothing he could do to save himself even though he did his job correctly. The AD Carry's team isn't happy because they just lost their biggest damage source and used a bunch of cooldowns to kill the assassin but didn't have enough time to use them earlier to save their carry. The assassin's tema isn't happy because to them they lost a player to Bronze level stupid aggro even though he killed his target because the lead gained was mostly lost giving the entire enemy team gold and losing the 5v4 advantage to make it 4v4.*

The ideal is to make assassins have a way to get OUT of fights safely but only if they did their job. This makes assassin feel better to play and reduces the frustration of having one of your own team as they aren't going to feed the enemy just for doing their job. **There was seriously a time (around Season 2 and part of Season 3 if I recall) that teams hated having an assassin as they were seen as useless and taking the place of a far more valuable mage with range and utility.**

The other ideal is to make assassins have to take a little bit of time to kill their targets. This has failed horribly for the entire duration of the game because Lifesteal + Crit can negate half an assassin's combo in one auto-attack, plus assassins tend to be melee and get instantly CC'd and exploded by Tanks and Supports the second they try to do anything. 

***Riot is trying to reduce frustration for the enemy team with the class update - now that players don't rage at having an assassin on their own team anymore - but this is unlikely to happen as long as assassins can be instantly deleted if they take longer than a second to kill targets.***

I have read almost all of the posts on this board and I feel I need to put in my two cents.  I play this game for the assassin role and would quit if it was changed for the worse. I have played every assassin in the game and I believe all assassins can be cancer, but they all have there weakness. I started in season 2 and was a mage main to start but fell in love with the deletion process.  Started as Akali went to Kat and finally Evolved into Diana who I spend 90 percent of my time playing.  I honestly love this game, I have never played another game as much as I have league of legends.

Akali- levels 1-5 is hell on earth, she is not at all easy to cs with if the person has some kind of poke. 

Kat- very weak at the start of the game, Poke her down, force her to not be able to engage. CC her ult.. COMMUNICATE WITH TEAM  and Don't Let Her Roam for free. Pantheon went mid and ate my lunch one game so bad I will never forget that game.

Fizz- Has a hard time clearing CS imo, watch for his level advantages and power spikes.  Dodge (if you can) the drop on playful trickster.

Diana- Missed Q pretty much equals no engage.  Especially if they dive in thinking the Q will hit and it misses then its death...

Talon- can engage hard but has no way of getting back out. If he thinks he can all in you then maybe you have stayed to long..
